comments:
Build ID: CosmosDemo07

It was suggested that the Europa driver is not stable enough to run the demo.  There are itermittant errors rendering the reports and editing xml files.  I had to modify the report templates to work with the stable version of eclipse 3.2.1 and BIRT 2.1.1

More information:
Here are the steps to run the demo with the new dependencies.

Download
=========
JRE 1.5
Eclipse 3.2.1 - http://fullmoon.torolab.ibm.com/downloads/drops/R-3.2.1-200609210945/download.php?dropFile=eclipse-SDK-3.2.1-win32.zip
EMF 2.2.1 - http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/emf/downloads/drops/2.2.1/R200609210005/emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.2.1.zip
GEF 3.2 - http://download.eclipse.org/tools/gef/downloads/drops/R-3.2.1-200609211617/GEF-runtime-3.2.1.zip
BIRT 2.1.1 - http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/drops/R-R1-2_1_1-200609260959/birt-report-framework-2_1_1.zip
Download Derby  10.0

Checkout from CVS
=================
Repository: /cvsroot/tptp
Module: platform/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models

Repository: /cvsroot/technology
Module:org.eclipse.cosmos/examples/eclipseCon07/org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.repository


Repository: /cvsroot/technology
Module:org.eclipse.cosmos/examples/eclipseCon07/org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.reports.oda


Repository: /cvsroot/technology
Module:org.eclipse.cosmos/examples/eclipseCon07/org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.reports.templates


Steps to run
=============
1. Start up ecilpse.
2. Open org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.reports.oda\src\org\eclipse\cosmos\dr\reports\oda\ResourcesDataAccessor.java
3. Modify the following line to point to the correct xml file location.
	private static String SML_RESOURCES_FOLDER = "file:///e|/development/COSMOS-Demo-EclipseCon2007/eclipse/demo/org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.repository/topologies/";

4. Open org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models\src-dms\org\eclipse\tptp\platform\internal\dms\log\impl\RDBLogDataStoreManager.java
5. Modify the following line to point to the correct derby jar file location.
	jdbcHelper.setURLString("file:/c:/COSMOS-Demo-EclipseCon2007/derby/db-derby-10.2.2.0-bin/lib/derbyclient.jar");

6. Open org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models\src-dms\org\eclipse\tptp\platform\internal\dms\statistical\impl\RDBStatisticalDataStoreManager.java
7. Modify the following line to point to the correct derby jar file location.
	jdbcHelper.setURLString("file:/c:/COSMOS-Demo-EclipseCon2007/derby/db-derby-10.2.2.0-bin/lib/derbyclient.jar");

8. unzip sample data under %DERBY_INSTALL%\frameworks\NetworkServer\bin
9. Run %DERBY_INSTALL%\frameworks\NetworkServer\bin\setNetworkServerCP.bat
10. Run %DERBY_INSTALL%\frameworks\NetworkServer\bin\startNetworkServer.bat

11. In your eclipse workspace expand to: org.eclipse.cosmos.examples.eclipsecon07.reports.templates > templates 
12. Open cosmos-nodes.rptdesign in the Report Editor.
13. Click the "Preview" tab in the Report Editor.

Created an attachment (id=59145)
patch that contains update to report templates to work with BIRT 2.1.1 and Eclipse 3.2.1

Mark can you apply this patch to CVS.

(In reply to comment #0)
I forgot to mention that you should also download TPTP 4.4 
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/tptp/4.4.0/dev/TPTP-4.4.0-200702150100/tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.4.0-200702150100.zip

Verifed that the driver works.  I was able to run the reports.

(In reply to comment #3)
> New driver available at http://people.apache.org/~jhawkins/COSMOS

(In reply to comment #4)
> Verifed that the driver works.  I was able to run the reports.
> 
> (In reply to comment #3)
> > New driver available at http://people.apache.org/~jhawkins/COSMOS
>

(In reply to comment #5)

I've seen this problem before.  It's usually the result of an empty dataset.  Probably because the data source is not configured properly.  You should check your web.xml file.

(In reply to comment #6)
> (In reply to comment #5)
> 
> I've seen this problem before.  It's usually the result of an empty dataset. 
> Probably because the data source is not configured properly.  You should check
> your web.xml file.
> 

I fixed the JDBC driver path, I'm still getting the same error. The Log report shows up with no data, empty charts and table.

(In reply to comment #7)

I've also seen this problem.  It has something to do with the derbyclient.jar and IBM jdk.  There's some kind of class version violation.  Are you using Sun JDK 1.5?

(In reply to comment #8)
> (In reply to comment #7)
> 
> I've also seen this problem.  It has something to do with the derbyclient.jar
> and IBM jdk.  There's some kind of class version violation.  Are you using Sun
> JDK 1.5?
> 
Yes SUN 1.5_06, I think this should be the first one supported in the demo.
Sheldon, Could you review this? I believe it is fixed by now. If so, can you close it out? Or let me know if there is something I need to handle here. Thanks.
